clinical_study.brief_title: Medical-economic Evaluation Comparing Intensive Outpatient Monitoring of Neuro-cardiovascular Diseases by Nurses, Doctors and Hospital and Private-sector Pharmacists, Compared to Usual Monitoring.
clinical_study.official_title: Medical-economic Evaluation Comparing Intensive Outpatient Monitoring of Neuro-cardiovascular Diseases by Nurses, Doctors and Hospital and Private-sector Pharmacists, Compared to Usual Monitoring.

primary_outcome.measure: Cost-utility ratio of the intensive monitoring strategy for each condition (stroke / myocardial infarction)
primary_outcome.description: 24-month incremental cost-utility ratio associated with the intensive post-stroke or post-MI follow-up strategy compared to the usual post-stroke or post-MI follow-up strategy, expressed as cost per year of life gained in good health (costs / QALY, score measured using EQ-5D-3L®).

arm_group.description: Patient with either primary stroke, recurrent stroke, hemorrhagic, ischemic or Transient Ischemic Attack (TIA) with regular follow-up
Patient with either primary stroke, recurrent stroke, hemorrhagic, ischemic or Transient Ischemic Attack (TIA) with intensive follow-up
Patient who has had a first or recurrent myocardial infarction with usual follow-up
Patient who has had a first or recurrent myocardial infarction with intensive follow-up

intervention.description: 2 medical consultations (nurse and doctor) over 24 months
10 medical visits (nurse, doctor, pharmacist) over 24 months

study_pop.textblock: patients with stroke or myocardial infarction
